results.name: Number of ways to represent the n-th prime as arithmetic mean of three other odd primes.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
example: a(5)=5 as A000040(5)=11 and there are no more representations not containing 11 than 11 = (3+7+23)/3 = (3+13+17)/3 = (5+5+23)/3 = (7+7+19)/3 = (7+13+13)/3.
maple: N:= 300: # to get the first A000720(N) terms
for i from 1 to nP do
for j from i to nP do
for k from j to nP while P[i]+P[j]+P[k] <= 3*N do
if r::integer and isprime(r) and r <> P[j] and r <= N then V[r]:= V[r]+1 fi
mathematica: M = 300; (* to get the first A000720(M) *)
P = Select[Range[3, 3*M, 2], PrimeQ]; nP = Length[P]; V = Table[0, {M}];
Table[V[[Prime[i]]], {i, 1, PrimePi[M]}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 09 2019, after _Robert Israel_ *)
program: a071704 n = z (us ++ vs) 0 (3 * q)  where
z ps'@(p:ps) i m = if m < p then 0 else z ps' (i+1) (m - p) + z ps i m
(us, _:vs) = span (< q) a065091_list; q = a000040 n
(PARI) a(n, p=prime(n))=my(s=0); forprime(q=p+2, 3*p-4, my(t=3*p-q); forprime(r=max(t-q, 3), (3*p-q)\2, if(t!=p+r && isprime(t-r), s++))); s \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 04 2015
